reporting-org.narrative: Department of Health and Human Services

title.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: Global Disease Detection (GDD) Program

description.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Center for Global Health (CGH) Division of Global Health Protection (DGHP) Global Disease Detection (GDD) Program builds global health security capacity to respond to infectious disease threats and protect lives by helping countries meet their commitments to the World Health Organization (WHO) International Health Regulations (2005). The GDD Program engages with ministries of health and other implementing partners to improve the local capacity in technical areas such as epidemiology, emergency management and response, laboratory biosafety and biosecurity, quality management systems, and level-appropriate diagnostic methodologies.

reporting-org.narrative: Department of Health and Human Services

title.narrative: CDC Investigations and Technical Assistance: Protecting and Improving Health Globally

description.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Investigations and Technical Assistance assists national and local health authorities and other health related organizations in controlling communicable diseases, chronic diseases and disorders, and other preventable health conditions. Investigations and evaluation of all methods of controlling or preventing disease and disability are carried out by providing epidemic aid, surveillance, technical assistance, consultation, and program support; and by providing leadership and coordination of joint national, state, and local efforts.

title.narrative: Global AIDS: Expand Coverage and Improve the Quality of Facility and Community-based Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV (PMTCT) in Cameroon under PEPFAR

description.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. Government initiative to help save the lives of those suffering from HIV/AIDS around the world. This historic commitment is the largest by any nation to combat a single disease internationally, and PEPFAR investments also help alleviate suffering from other diseases across the global health spectrum. PEPFAR is the cornerstone and largest component of the U.S. President's Global Health Initiative. With a special focus on improving the health of women, newborns and children, the Global Health Initiative's goal is to save the greatest number of lives by increasing and building upon what works and, then, supporting countries as they work to improve the health of their own people.

reporting-org.narrative: Department of Health and Human Services

title.narrative: Protecting and Improving Health Globally:Building and Strengthening Public Health Impact, Systems,Capacity and Security

description.narrative: Global Health Security Partner Engagement: Expanding Efforts and Strategies to Protect and Improve Public Health Globally. U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) global health efforts are to assist Ministries of Health and other international partners to plan, manage effectively, and evaluate public health programs; achieve U.S. Government program and international organization goals to improve health, including disease eradication and elimination targets; expand CDC's global health programs that focus on the leading causes of worldwide mortality, morbidity and disability, including chronic disease and injuries; generate and apply new knowledge to achieve health goals; and, strengthen health systems and their impact.

title.narrative: Global AIDS: Strengthening Public Health Laboratory Systems in Cameroon under PEPFAR

description.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. Government initiative to help save the lives of those suffering from HIV/AIDS around the world. This historic commitment is the largest by any nation to combat a single disease internationally, and PEPFAR investments also help alleviate suffering from other diseases across the global health spectrum. PEPFAR is the cornerstone and largest component of the U.S. President's Global Health Initiative. With a special focus on improving the health of women, newborns and children, the Global Health Initiative's goal is to save the greatest number of lives by increasing and building upon what works and, then, supporting countries as they work to improve the health of their own people.

title.narrative: Global AIDS: Develop, Implement and Sustain High Quality Comprehensive HIV Cascade Services for Children, Adolescents and Adults in Facilities and Community-based Settings in Cameroon under PEPFAR

description.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. Government initiative to help save the lives of those suffering from HIV/AIDS around the world. This historic commitment is the largest by any nation to combat a single disease internationally, and PEPFAR investments also help alleviate suffering from other diseases across the global health spectrum. PEPFAR is the cornerstone and largest component of the U.S. President's Global Health Initiative. With a special focus on improving the health of women, newborns and children, the Global Health Initiative's goal is to save the greatest number of lives by increasing and building upon what works and, then, supporting countries as they work to improve the health of their own people.

This historic commitment is the largest by any nation to combat a single disease internationally, and PEPFAR investments also help alleviate suffering from other diseases across the global health spectrum. PEPFAR is the cornerstone and largest component of the U.S. President's Global Health Initiative. With a special focus on improving the health of women, newborns and children, the Global Health Initiative's goal is to save the greatest number of lives by increasing and building upon what works and, then, supporting countries as they work to improve the health of their own people.
